alert.note: Alert for Forest; Oneida (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 16 at 4:17AM CDT until October 17 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...LAKE-EFFECT SNOW SHOWERS EXPECTED TONIGHT AND MONDAY... .A cold north flow across Lake Superior will generate periods of lake-effect snow showers tonight through Monday. The combination of snow and some blowing and drifting snow, and this being the first significant snowfall of the season will likely result in hazardous travel conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Some blowing and drifting snow on Monday. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches possible in far northwest Oneida and northern Forest counties, with 1 to 3 inches elsewhere. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph on Monday. * WHERE...Oneida and Forest Counties. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: This being the first significant snowfall of the season, plan extra travel into any trips tonight or Monday. Be sure to slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
